    About me

    I am a PhD student at Royal Holloway University of London under the supervision of Prof. Vincent Jansen and Prof. Elli Leadbeater. My research is all about using computational and mathematical models to better understand animal behaviour, particularly collective behaviours. What drives me is a need to understand how things in the natural world work and how the behaviour of animals is shaped no only by their own experiences, but by interactions with others.

    I am passionate about coding and predominantly work in R and Python. Open, transparent and reproducible science lie at the core of my working routine and so I am committed to organising my data and code under standard practice.
